body:
The method lastIndexOf looks for the starting position of the last occurence of your String. In your case you have only one occurence of "to" so they both find the same.

To get a different result, you would need an input like :

"to Mike and to Charles."

In that case, lastIndexOf would return the starting position of "to Charles".
title: Why is lastIndexOf(String) apparently functioning the exact same as indexOf(String)?
